did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Personal journals, correspondence, and other personal papers.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Born Sept. 13, 1934, in Lebanon, N.H., he earned a doctorate in English at the University of Wisconsin-Madison in 1964 and served as an assistant professor at the University of Pittsburgh and then at Brooklyn College, where he became a full professor. He retired in 1995. Merritt and his partner, John Payne Hawker, bought a home in Provincetown, Mass. around 1970, where he spent most summers and made frequent trips in the winter. He died Dec. 23, 2004.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Personal journals, correspondence, and other personal papers.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: James Douglas Merritt papers, #7744. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
